# How does the process of updating a treatment plan work in practice compared to initial signing

Here’s a clear comparison of the **treatment plan update process versus the initial signing** in mental health or service-planning contexts:

## Initial Signing of a Treatment Plan

- The **initial treatment plan** is developed during or shortly after the intake/assessment phase, often within the first 15–30 days of care (timeframes can vary by agency)[^8_1][^8_2][^8_3]
In some cases, supervisors or physicians must also sign[^8_3]

## Key Differences

| Initial Signing | Updating Process |
| :-- | :-- |
| Created during/soon after intake | Occurs periodically (3–6 months) or as needed |
| Sets baseline goals, diagnosis, etc
